alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Sandia and Manzano Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 14 at 2:19PM MDT until June 15 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THURSDAY FOR PORTIONS OF CENTRAL AND EAST-CENTRAL NEW MEXICO DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .An upper level trough approaching from the west will spread strong west to southwest winds over much of the region Thursday. The combination of rising temperatures, very low humidity, strong winds, and an unstable airmass will produce critical fire weather conditions. Single-digit humidities will last 6 to 12 hours for portions of the Middle Rio Grande Valley. Any fires that develop over the next few days will have the potential for significant growth in receptive fuel beds. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM MDT THURSDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from noon to 9 PM MDT Thursday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106), Sandia and Manzano Mountains (Zone 124), Central Highlands (Zone 125), and the East Central Plains (Zone 126) from Thursday afternoon into the early evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West southwest 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values of 5 to 12 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Sandia and Manzano Mountains
